comments:
Package Explorer-> (right click on an entry) Compare with->Revision:
After a small status window showing that eclipse is fetching the revisions,
there comes up a new window which is empty.

"Replace with > Revision" also does not work and don't show any window. I've got
the following messages in my .log:

This exception does not happen for me. Perhaps it only happens when there is 
an error fetching the revisions. Not critical for 3.0.

I notice from your traceback that you are using CVSNT (which is not officially 
supported). You may want to try turning on repository prefixes and enabling 
the "pretend to be a Unix server" option (on the Advanced tab of the CVSNT 
configuration page).

Yes, it's CVSNT...
I've tried your workaround (Unix-compatible mode, repository prefix), but it
made no difference.

Don't worry, I will wait for a fix in Eclipse 3.1 ;)

Replace with revision doesn't seem to work for me either.  It lists the revisons
but provides no means for me to replace my revision with a different revision. 
Is the proper behavior to list revisions or should it actually allow you to
select a revision and which replaces yours?

If the revision compares are configured to use an editor, there should be a 
Get Contents and a Get Sticky Revision menu item in the context menu of the 
revision table. These are the commands you use to replace.

This was most likely an issue with how CVSNT was configured. The following 
link identifies the support CVSNT version and describes how it need to be 
configured to work with Eclipse.
